document_title: Chronic heart failure: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Chronic heart failure or chronic heart failure is a condition in which the heart cannot continuously pump enough blood throughout the body to ensure adequate oxygen supply. There are many causes leading to this condition, including some of the most common risk factors, such as old age, diabetes, hypertension, overweight... Chronic heart failure is most common in men. (first)
The term “heart failure” does not mean the heart stops beating, but rather describes a condition in which the heart is weaker than normal in a healthy person. In some cases, mild heart failure causes symptoms that can only be noticed with exercise. In other cases, the condition can be more severe, causing life-threatening symptoms, even when the patient is resting.
